feed.title: LIS: Legume Information System
feed.subtitle: A collaborative, community resource to facilitate crop improvement by integrating genetic, genomic, and trait data across legume species.

entry.title: So, What is Jekyll?
entry.content:
Jekyll is a tool for transforming your plain text into static websites and blogs. It is simple, static, and blog-aware. Jekyll uses the Liquid templating language and has builtin Markdown and Textile support.

It also ties in nicely to Github Pages.

Learn more about Jekyll on their website.
entry.summary: Jekyll is a tool for transforming your plain text into static websites and blogs. It is simple, static, and blog-aware. Jekyll uses the Liquid templating language and has builtin Markdown and Textile support.

entry.title: So, What is Jekyll?
entry.content:
Jekyll is a tool for transforming your plain text into static websites and blogs. It is simple, static, and blog-aware. Jekyll uses the Liquid templating language and has builtin Markdown and Textile support.

It also ties in really really nicely to Github Pages.

Learn more about Jekyll on their website.
